dialogues.text: Like father like son, huh? The guard looks at Skinhead and his grim attire. A long pause and he nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amanda and Keith move through the dark museum. Moonlight shines down through skylights, security lights throw oc- casional shafts of light across the floor and walls. It's massive, silent and forbidden.

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: Have you ever been here before?

dialogues.speaker: AMANDA
dialogues.text: In grade school.

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: I come all the time. But I've never been here at night. Do you like it?

dialogues.speaker: AMANDA
dialogues.text: It feels pretty good being somewhere I'm not supposed to be.

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: Or being with someone you're not supposed to be with? Amanda smiles. Keith abruptly changes the subject.

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: This place is my church. I can come here and what anybody says about me doesn't matter.

dialogues.speaker: AMANDA
dialogues.text: She looks around the gallery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paintings dimly lit, some more so than the others.

dialogues.speaker: AMANDA
dialogues.text: Something catches her eye. She looks closer. A quick startled look at Keith.

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: A sly smile. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: AMANDA
dialogues.text: Looks again at the paintings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The painting Keith was working on at school is complete and hanging on the wall.

dialogues.speaker: AMANDA
dialogues.text: She's startled to see it.

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: The smile.

dialogues.speaker: AMANDA
dialogues.text: She's shocked, flattered, stunned. A huge smile spreads across her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amanda sits on a stone bench. She pulls a leg up to her chest and stares at the painting. Keith sits down next to her. She looks at him. Looks at the painting. MUSIC COMES UP and CARRIES ACROSS THE CUT into the next sequence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Jaguar is still parked in front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drummer Girl's sitting in the car with her back to the do her legs stretched out on the seat. She's lost in a deep sadness. She pulls up a knee, looks at her tights, looks at her jacket. Feels foolish for the way she's dressed. Feels foolish that she's tried to be a girl and in her mi failed.

dialogues.speaker: DRUMMER GIRL
dialogues.text: Her eyes are filled with tears. She's trying to hold back She's slowly shaking her head, no. A tear spills. She wipes it away with the back of her hand. More tears spill She can't wipe them away. She bows her head and succumbs to her feelings.  113.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big and empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drummer Girl is high up in the seats. She's laying on her back, looking up at the sky.

dialogues.speaker: AMANDA AND KEITH
dialogues.text: They're sitting on the edge of the stage. Keith's hanging his legs over the side. She's turned, facing him, legs drawn up, chin on her knees.

dialogues.speaker: AMANDA
dialogues.text: What do you see in me? Be honest.

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: What do you see in me?

dialogues.speaker: AMANDA
dialogues.text: Okay. Me first?

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: AMANDA
dialogues.text: Okay. She thinks for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: AMANDA
dialogues.text: I see a way out of where I am. Keith looks at her. He thinks he understands. He's please at where the conversation's going.

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: AMANDA
dialogues.text: I'm locked in a small, petty world. I never had any idea who you were other than some- body who was different than everybody else.

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: You mean strange? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: AMANDA
dialogues.text: Yeah. Sort of.

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: And now?

dialogues.speaker: AMANDA
dialogues.text: I don't think anybody ever thought anything of me other than I look good next to them. And I went because I'd rather be next to someone for the wrong reasons than be alone for the right reasons.

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: (unequivocally) I'd rather be right.

dialogues.speaker: AMANDA
dialogues.text: You can stand being alone.

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: Nobody can stand being alone. If you stop thinking there's somebody for you somewhere, it's over. Isn't it?
She sits up and looks down at Amanda and Keith on the sta

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns to face her.

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: I've been waiting a long time. And I still don't have it. But I will.

dialogues.speaker: AMANDA
dialogues.text: I don't know what you mean.

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: Yeah, you do.

dialogues.speaker: AMANDA
dialogues.text: I don't. I swear.

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: This was all a joke. I was set up. I was used. Right? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SOME KIND OF WONDERFUL - Rev. 8/8/86 115. 193

dialogues.speaker: AMANDA
dialogues.text: You think I used you?

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: Didn't you? Amanda holds a long look on him. There's no way out.

dialogues.speaker: AMANDA
dialogues.text: In a way.

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: There's only one way to use someone, Amanda. You do, or you don't. Keith's noble stance snaps Amanda. She turns on him. The anger she's been holding in pours out.

dialogues.speaker: AMANDA
dialogues.text: And you didn't use me? You hypocrite! What's hanging in the museum? My soul? It's my face! I look just as good next to you as I do next to Hardy or any other guy, right? Are you in love with me?

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: I think I might be.

dialogues.speaker: AMANDA
dialogues.text: You're not. This isn't love and affection. This is revenge. You're using me to pay back every guy with more money and more friends and more power than you. Paint it any color you want, it's you using me. There's a long pause as Keith sees the truth behind her attack.

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: You're right. I did use you. I used you. For all those reasons. Amanda appreciates his honesty. It deserves reconciliatio

dialogues.speaker: AMANDA
dialogues.text: And I used you. It's true. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SOME KIND OF WONDERFUL - Rev. 8/8/86 116.

dialogues.speaker: AMANDA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It wasn't deliberate. It just happened. You were the right thing at the wrong time. If I'd thought about it, I never would have done it. All I was thinking about was getting away from Hardy.

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: And I used you to stand up for myself.

dialogues.speaker: AMANDA
dialogues.text: Maybe we should call it even.

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: Maybe. Keith reaches into his pocket and takes out a jewelry box

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: This is for you.

dialogues.speaker: AMANDA
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: My future. In this box is my future. Amanda looks at the box.

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: And I'm giving it to you. Every dime I have to my name. It's yours. He hands her the box. She takes it with hesitation. She opens it. The contents startle her.

dialogues.speaker: BOX CONTENTS
dialogues.text: Two diamond studs.

dialogues.speaker: AMANDA
dialogues.text: She looks at Keith with concern.

dialogues.speaker: AMANDA
dialogues.text: I can't take these. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SOME KIND OF WONDERFUL - Rev. 8/8/86 117. 193

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: He nods.

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: You have to.

dialogues.speaker: KEITH AND AMANDA
dialogues.text: Amanda shakes her head and closes the box.

dialogues.speaker: AMANDA
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: You deserve them. I'm giving them to you. I know you like them. I saw you wearing Shayne's, remember? Amanda nods.

dialogues.speaker: AMANDA
dialogues.text: It's insane. This makes no sense, Keith.

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: They're yours. For good. You don't have to borrow from any- body anymore. You're too good to do that again.

dialogues.speaker: AMANDA
dialogues.text: I never heard of anybody doing anything like this.

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: I'm sure it happens every day. Not to everybody, but to the ones who believe in themselves. She bows her head. The tears start. She can't help her- self. Every negative thought she's had about herself sur- faces. Keith's purity, the scope of his sacrifice over- whelms her.

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: Why are you crying?

dialogues.speaker: AMANDA
dialogues.text: I feel so terrible for what I did. I hated the pressure, I hated feeling ashamed. (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SOME KIND OF WONDERFUL - Rev. 8/8/86 117A.

dialogues.speaker: AMANDA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I hated where I was from. I hated that all my friends got everything their hearts desired. I gave in to my hatred, and I turned on what I believed in. I didn't have to. You didn't.

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: So, you won't do it again. You don't have to. Ever. Amanda leans forward and kisses Keith. She puts her arms around his neck and pulls him to her.  118.

dialogues.speaker: DRUMMER GIRL
dialogues.text: She's watching. She looks away. It's too painful. It's over. She gets up and exits.

dialogues.speaker: AMANDA AND KEITH
dialogues.text: On the stage, engulfed in one another's arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two people, one speck on the stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drummer Girl's sitting on the hood, feet out, back agains the windshield. She turns and looks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keith and Amanda approach the car. He has his arm around her.

dialogues.speaker: DRUMMER GIRL
dialogues.text: She tries her best to not look hurt. She manages a grim smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keith and Amanda reach the car. Drummer Girl swings her legs over the side.

dialogues.speaker: DRUMMER GIRL
dialogues.text: Now what?

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: Hardy's house. Amanda's alarmed. Guilt and fear. She looks at Drummer Girl. She's equally shocked.

dialogues.speaker: DRUMMER GIRL
dialogues.text: Keith? Have you forgotten something? Hardy wants to beat the crap out of you.

dialogues.speaker: AMANDA
dialogues.text: It's for real, Keith.

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: I know. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DRUMMER GIRL
dialogues.text: If you want to do that, you drive yourself.

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: I have to face him sooner or later. He opens the door for Amanda.

dialogues.speaker: AMANDA
dialogues.text: It's not just Hardy. It's his friends, too.

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: I can handle it.

dialogues.speaker: DRUMMER GIRL
dialogues.text: Keith! I can beat the crap out of you. You won't last six seconds.

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: Come on. Amanda gives him a last long look and gets in. Keith clos the door.

dialogues.speaker: DRUMMER GIRL
dialogues.text: Don't go overboard, studly.

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: I know what I'm doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lots of cars. A serious party's in progress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's LOUD and crowded. Not particularly rowdy. It's an older crowd who've partied together many times before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's in the living room. Sitting on a couch with his arm around Mia. He's not having a great time. He's on the wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Jaguar pulls up in front. Keith gets out. He helps Amanda out. Drummer girl gets out her side. Keith looks at the house. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DRUMMER GIRL
dialogues.text: You don't have to do this.

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: Yeah, I do.

dialogues.speaker: DRUMMER GIRL
dialogues.text: Okay. I'll be here. She gives him a "thumbs up." Keith puts his arm around Amanda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The front door opens. People are milling about. People can be seen in the lit windows. Someone in the door spots them. Points them out to another. Word spreads.

dialogues.speaker: KEITH AND AMANDA
dialogues.text: They exchange looks. He holds up his hand. She claps it. A smile both ways, and they head up to the house.

dialogues.speaker: DRUMMER GIRL
dialogues.text: She closes the door and leans against the car. She rests her chin on her hands and watches the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Word has reached him that he has a visitor. He gets up of the couch, abruptly dumping Mia. He crosses to the foyer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They continue to the house. Keith's courage is waning. Amanda squeezes his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOVING IN on the open door. People are gathered in the doorway. The crowd separates to reveal Hardy. He's smiling. Ready.

dialogues.speaker: HARDY
dialogues.text: Welcome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keith and Amanda step into the marble foyer. The crowd backs away to give them an inescapable feeling of isola- tion. Hardy's calm and as charming as ever. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HARDY
dialogues.text: I'm glad you could come by. (looks at his watch) It's late. I was worried you were gonna disappoint us. Mia pushes through the crowd and slips her arms around hi waist. He kisses her forehead.

dialogues.speaker: HARDY
dialogues.text: (to Keith) Have a good time?

dialogues.speaker: AMANDA
dialogues.text: She knows the display with the girl is only an attempt to humiliate her. She tries to let no emotion show.

dialogues.speaker: HARDY
dialogues.text: A wicked glint in his eye. He addresses Keith.

dialogues.speaker: HARDY
dialogues.text: She's deceptively innocent, isn't she? So clean and nice on the outside.

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: Sharp internal reaction.

dialogues.speaker: AMANDA
dialogues.text: She'd like to tear Hardy's throat out.

dialogues.speaker: HARDY
dialogues.text: A slick smile.

dialogues.speaker: HARDY
dialogues.text: (vicious, bitter) She do you?

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: It's all he can do to keep from striking out at Hardy.

dialogues.speaker: AMANDA
dialogues.text: She glares at Hardy. Looks around the room. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her friends. They avoid her eyes. All ashamed that they'r not doing anything in her defense. A scan across them end ing on Shayne. She can't look at Amanda. She doesn't con- done what Hardy's saying, but she doesn't try to stop it. She's sitting on the fence.

dialogues.speaker: AMANDA
dialogues.text: As much as Hardy hurts her, Shayne's reaction almost hurt her more.

dialogues.speaker: HARDY
dialogues.text: He's not finished with Amanda.

dialogues.speaker: HARDY
dialogues.text: (to Keith) The one thing I'm happy about is you get her used.

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: He's had enough. He lunges at Hardy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keith drives Hardy against the wall. Hardy's friends jump in and pull Keith away. Hardy straightens up.

dialogues.speaker: HARDY
dialogues.text: That wasn't very smart, friend. He rubs his neck and clears his throat.

dialogues.speaker: HARDY
dialogues.text: I was letting you off. I don't care about you. He glares at Amanda.

dialogues.speaker: HARDY
dialogues.text: She's the trash. (to Keith) You're just a fool. (to his friends) Take him outside and kick the shit out of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His guests stare at him. No response. No movement. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HARDY
dialogues.text: He's annoyed. He doesn't understand their hesitation.

dialogues.speaker: HARDY
dialogues.text: I said take him outside.

dialogues.speaker: BOY
dialogues.text: Stares at Hardy.

dialogues.speaker: GIRL
dialogues.text: Stares at Hardy. No love. CLOSEUP - ANOTHER BOY. Cold stare.

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: He looks around the room.

dialogues.speaker: HARDY
dialogues.text: He can't believe his powers have failed him.

dialogues.speaker: HARDY
dialogues.text: Is there a problem? A pause from Hardy. His eyes dart around the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cold eyes.

dialogues.speaker: HARDY
dialogues.text: A moment of panic.

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: A hint of a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keith steps forward.

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: Why don't you take me outside? room. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HARDY
dialogues.text: Full panic. It's clear now what's happened.

dialogues.speaker: HARDY
dialogues.text: Wait a minute. What is this? You're siding with this guy? Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A couple guys walk out the front door. A couple more. Girls. Mia slips away. More and more.

dialogues.speaker: HARDY
dialogues.text: What're you doing? (pause) If you leave, you don't come back. You really want to do this? I'm serious. Anybody who walks out on this is finished with me. Got it? Steven! What're you doing? Keith steps forward as the room empties. The last strag- glers exit. It's just Keith, Amanda and Hardy. Hardy's frightened.

dialogues.speaker: HARDY
dialogues.text: You want to forget about this? At this point, there's no reason for us to get into it. I'm perfectly willing to drop it. Keith smiles. Hardy's shown his true colors. That's enoug

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: You want the truth. The plain truth? You're over. Keith raises a hand in farewell. Amanda looks at him. Her anger hasn't subsided.

dialogues.speaker: AMANDA
dialogues.text: You're gonna walk?

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: There isn't anything I can do to him that he hasn't already done to himself. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: AMANDA
dialogues.text: I wish I could live with that. She turns back to Hardy. He stands alone and stunned in the foyer. She draws back and slaps him clean across the face. A sharp smack. She steps back, takes Keith's hand and they exit. Hardy stands alone, rubbing his stinging cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drummer Girl's on the lawn. She's been watching from out- side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keith and Amanda come out the door. Amanda's shaking her hand.

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: Remind me never to get you mad at me. She smiles. Keith looks across the lawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drummer Girl is waiting for them. She's jingling the car keys.

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: He'd momentarily forgotten about her. In the tension of the confrontation and the anticipation of it, Drummer Gir had vanished from his thoughts. It occurs to him that his victory is as much her doing as his.

dialogues.speaker: DRUMMER GIRL
dialogues.text: She manages a smile.

dialogues.speaker: AMANDA
dialogues.text: She smiles. Her eyes shift to Keith. The smile dissipates

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keith and Amanda step down off the porch and cross the la Drummer Girl comes forward from the car to meet them.

dialogues.speaker: DRUMMER GIRL
dialogues.text: Nice move. I saw it from out here. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Amanda smiles. Keith tries to smile. There's an uncom- fortable pause. The kind that always accompanies a pain- ful farewell.

dialogues.speaker: DRUMMER GIRL
dialogues.text: (trying not to break) So... why don't you guys go on. I'm gonna walk. (forces a smile) My butt's asleep from sitting all night. She offers her hand to Amanda. She takes it. Drummer Girl shakes it hard and sincere.

dialogues.speaker: DRUMMER GIRL
dialogues.text: Sorry if I misjudged you. She can barely hold in the tears. She backs away.

dialogues.speaker: DRUMMER GIRL
dialogues.text: The keys are in the car. She holds up her hand in farewell, turns and heads down t street.

dialogues.speaker: KEITH AND AMANDA
dialogues.text: They watch her go. Amanda looks at Keith watching Drummer Girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drummer Girl steps off the curb and heads down the street

dialogues.speaker: KEITH AND AMANDA
dialogues.text: Keith watches Drummer Girl. He's thinking. Forgetting everything. She's the only thing on his mind. Amanda reaches to her ear and removes a diamond stud. Then she removes the other. Keith turns to see her removing the second one. She takes his hand and places the studs in his palm. She curls his fingers closed around them.

dialogues.speaker: AMANDA
dialogues.text: I think you want to give these to someone else. Keith is startled that she knows what he's thinking. She kisses his cheek. Keith doesn't know what to say to her. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: AMANDA
dialogues.text: Go. Keith can't wait to take off. He kisses her cheek, turns and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: AMANDA
dialogues.text: Keith? She stops and turns.

dialogues.speaker: AMANDA
dialogues.text: I'll never forget you.

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: I'll never forget you, either. He turns and takes off. Amanda watches him with a proud smile. Shayne approaches from behind.

dialogues.speaker: SHAYNE
dialogues.text: Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: AMANDA
dialogues.text: Yeah. Shayne puts her arm around Amanda.

dialogues.speaker: SHAYNE
dialogues.text: You won.

dialogues.speaker: AMANDA
dialogues.text: I think I did.

dialogues.speaker: SHAYNE
dialogues.text: Come on. I'll give you a ride home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drummer Girl's marching down the middle of the street. Tears are running off her cheeks, staining her collar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's coming up behind her. He stops and calls to her.

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: Susan!

dialogues.speaker: DRUMMER GIRL
dialogues.text: She stops cold. Bewildered. She turns. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keith is running down the middle of the street.

dialogues.speaker: DRUMMER GIRL
dialogues.text: Anticipating the best.

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: He runs for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They meet.

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: I love you.
She bursts into tears. Keith sweeps her off the ground, spins her around and crushes her in his arms. his shirt, practically tearing it off him.

dialogues.speaker: KEITH AND DRUMMER GIRL
dialogues.text: She clutches They break the kiss. She gasps and presses her head to his chest and squeezes him.

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. I didn't know.

dialogues.speaker: DRUMMER GIRL
dialogues.text: You're stupid. I always knew you were stupid.

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: You never told me.

dialogues.speaker: DRUMMER GIRL
dialogues.text: You never asked. He pulls her away from him. He opens her hand and puts the studs in her palm. She looks up at him with a huge smile.

dialogues.speaker: DRUMMER GIRL
dialogues.text: I wanted these. I wanted 'em.

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: They're yours. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Drummer Girl immediately starts to put them on. Keith no- tices that, for the first time, she's not wearing a multi tude of earrings. Drummer Girl smiles. Keith laughs.

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: You knew! You knew you'd get "em.

dialogues.speaker: DRUMMER GIRL
dialogues.text: I didn't know. I just hoped.

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: No, you knew. Drummer Girl finishes and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: DRUMMER GIRLS
dialogues.text: I had a feeling. Just a feeling. They look okay? Keith nods.

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: You look good wearing my future.

dialogues.speaker: DRUMMER GIRL
dialogues.text: These babies go back in the morning. You're going to art school.

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: We'll keep one and make it a ring. She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: DRUMMER GIRL
dialogues.text: You don't want to think about that one, do you? Keith shakes his head, no. There's no doubt in his mind. She draws him to her and gently presses her lips to his. He folds her into his arms, and we PULL BACK. They break the embrace and start down the street. MUSIC COMES UP.

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: I had this feeling when you kissed me that something was happening.

dialogues.speaker: DRUMMER GIRL
dialogues.text: Why didn't you say anything? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: I feared for my life.

dialogues.speaker: DRUMMER GIRL
dialogues.text: You know, that was the first time I kissed anybody.

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: DRUMMER GIRL
dialogues.text: How do you know?

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: Because you did it wrong.

dialogues.speaker: DRUMMER GIRL
dialogues.text: I did not!

dialogues.speaker: KEITH
dialogues.text: Yeah, you did.

dialogues.speaker: DRUMMER GIRL
dialogues.text: How do you do it wrong? She stops and one last kiss. FADE OUT.
